docreader.list

Class ListReaderPlain

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.list.ListReaderPlain

  • final class ListReaderPlain
extends java.lang.Object
    Computes the number text which prepends each list paragraph

    Note: This class only handles the raw number text and does not apply any further formatting as described in [MS-DOC], v20140721, 2.4.6.3, Part 3 to it.

    Note 2: The tplc, a visual override for the appearance of list levels, as defined in [MS-DOC], v20140721, 2.9.328 is not taken care of in this class.

    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Method Detail

      • getFormattedNumber

        public java.lang.String getFormattedNumber(ParagraphListAware paragraph)
        Get the formatted number for a given paragraph

        Note: This only works correctly if called subsequently for all paragraphs in a valid selection (main document, text field, ...) which are part of a list.

        Parameters:
        paragraph - list paragraph to process
        Returns:
        String which represents the numbering of this list paragraph; never null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given paragraph is null or is not part of a list
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If problems with the document are encountered

      • getLvlOfLastProcessedParagraph

        org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.ListLevel getLvlOfLastProcessedParagraph()
        Returns:
        The true Lvl, with respect to any possible overrides, of the last paragraph processed by getFormattedNumber(ParagraphListAware)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no lvl is available, yet

      • isIndentationMustBePreserved

        boolean isIndentationMustBePreserved()
        Returns:
        true if the left indentation of the last paragraph paragraph processed by getFormattedNumber(ParagraphListAware) must be preserved despite any list formatting; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no flag is available, yet

      • getLevelTuple

        private ListReaderPlain.LevelTupleReadOnly getLevelTuple(int iLfoCur,
                                                         int iLvlCur,
                                                         org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.ListFormatOverrideLevel lfolvl,
                                                         org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.ListLevel lvl,
                                                         org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.ListLevel lvlNotOverridden)
        Finds the correct level tuple (=the internal store) for a given level in a given list and increments it for the next call
        Parameters:
        iLfoCur - current level format overwrite index
        iLvlCur - current level index
        lfolvl - ListFormatOverrideLevel data
        lvl - ListLevel data, may come from an override
        lvlNotOverridden - ListLevel data, not from any override
        Returns:
        a LevelTuple which may only be used for reading purposes

      • checkStartAtRange

        private static int checkStartAtRange(int iStartAt)
        Checks if a given startAt value, used for the number of the first item in a particular list level, is in a valid range
        Parameters:
        iStartAt - startAt value to be checked
        Returns:
        the same startAt value, unless it is invalid
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the document is malformed.

      • getTrueIlfo

        private int getTrueIlfo(int ilfo)
        Obtains the true ilfo for a given paragraph.

        Sometimes Word stores the inversion of the actual ilfo in order to convey information related to paragraph indentation. This method takes care of this.

        Parameters:
        ilfo - Ilfo as obtained from POI
        Returns:
        ilfo which can be used as a pointer into rgLfo
